description: Alteration of roof from hip to gable end, rear roof extension, single storey rear extension (following demolition of existing single storey rear addition), replacement side window to main roofslope, installation of chimney, installation of rooflight (main roof slope), alteration to and installation of ground floor side window (south elevation) and installation of rooflights to front and side roofslope (main roofslope)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Block Plan drawing no.P-06 Rev 1 dated 6th November 2019, Proposed First Floor and Roof Plans drawing no. P-08 Rev 1 dated 6th November 2019, Proposed Elevations P-09 Rev 1 dated 6th November 2019 and Proposed Sections P-10 Rev 1 dated 6th November 2019
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building and as per item 5 of submitted application form and as per Condition 2 - Approved plans.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4, 7B and 7D of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 (h)(j), 1.2 (f), 2.1 and 2.10, policies D1 and D2 Draft New London Plan 2018, policies 7.1, 7.2, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2016 and National Planning Policy Framework 2019 - Section 12 Achieving well-designed places
| No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013 and National Planning Policy Framework 2019 - section 12 Achieving well-designed places.

| The proposed upper floor window (roof) in the side elevations of the main dwellinghouse, facing no.27 West Lodge Avenue shall contain only obscure glass (minimum level 3 obscure glazed) and non-opening unless the parts of the windows can be opened are more than 1.7 metres above the floor of the rooms in which the windows are installed. The windows so approved shall be retained permanently.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties, in accordance with policy 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 (g), 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Adopted Core Strategy (2012), policy D2 of the Draft London Plan 2018, policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2016 and National Planning Policy Framework 2019 - section 12 Achieving well-designed places.
